name: Dimitrios PAPADIMOULIS
text: After consulting the political groups, I would like to inform you of the following changes to the agenda: Following the redistribution of votes to the different voting procedures, the final votes on the CAP package - the Jahr, MÃ¼ller and Andrieu reports move to today's second voting procedure. Consequently, the third voting procedure scheduled for today, Friday 23 October, from 6 p.m. to 7.15 p.m., is cancelled, as is the announcement of the results at 9.30 p.m. Up-to-date voting information is available on the European Parliament's website in the 'Important information and documents' section. Is there an objection? The change is approved.

name: Dimitrios PAPADIMOULIS
text: We shall proceed to today's first vote. We shall vote on the dossiers as on the agenda. The vote will run from 9 a.m. to 10:15 p.m. The same voting method used in previous votes will be used. All votes will be taken by roll call. I declare the first vote to begin. You can vote until 10.15. The results of the first vote will be announced at 12.45 p.m. (The sitting was suspended at 9.01 a.m.)

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: We now come to the opening of the second round of voting today. We shall vote on the dossiers on the agenda. The voting round is open from 1.15 p.m. to 2.30 p.m.  The same voting procedure will apply as in the previous rounds of voting. All votes are roll-call votes. I declare the second round of voting open. You have until 2.30 p.m. to vote. The results of the second round of voting will be announced at 5 p.m. (The sitting was suspended at 1.19 p.m.)

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: The minutes of the meetings from 19 to 23 October will be submitted to Parliament for approval at the beginning of the next sitting. If there are no objections, I will pass on the resolutions adopted in these meetings to the persons and bodies mentioned in the resolutions. Finally, at the end of today's sitting, the President asked me to make the following statement to you, which is also entirely in my interest. Therefore, on behalf of the President, on behalf of myself and all my fellow Members, I would like to thank the staff of Parliament and all the people who have made this plenary session possible and who contribute daily to Parliament's work in the current challenging situation.  Without you, Members of Parliament would not be able to continue to exercise their mandate in full, to legislate and to represent our citizens at a time when democracy must be at the heart of our Union. Thank you for your work, your dedication, your professionalism and your commitment. And I would like to reiterate my support for this thanks.

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: I declare the session of the European Parliament adjourned.
